Solidary obligation is terminated—i.e. all the solidary debtors are released, and the right ol all tbe solidary creditors is extin- guished— by simple satisfaction oi the sole creditor, or by satis· laction ol one ol the creditore hythe single debtor. This may occur (r) by performance, solutio, or (a) by set-off extending to the whole ol the debt. But acquittal of one solidary debtor in an action brought on his obligation did not release the rest lrom theirs: ‘plures eiusdem pecuniae mand-atores, si unus iudicio eligatur, absolutione quoque secuta non liberantur, sed omnes liberantur pecunia soluta' Dig. 46. r. 25. 3.
